definitions.definition: A bounding straight edge of a two-dimensional shape .
A flat surface of a three-dimensional object; a face .
One half (left or right, top or bottom, front or back, etc.) of something or someone.
examples: Which side of the tray shall I put it on? The patient was bleeding on the right side .

definitions.definition: A region in a specified position with respect to something.
examples: Meet me on the north side of the monument.

definitions.definition: The portion of the human torso usually covered by the arms when they are not raised ; the areas on the left and right between the belly or chest and the back .
examples: I generally sleep on my side .

definitions.definition: One surface of a sheet of paper (used instead of "page", which can mean one or both surfaces.)
examples: John wrote 15 sides for his essay!

definitions.definition: One possible aspect of a concept , person , or thing .
One set of competitors in a game .
A sports team .
A group of morris dancers who perform together.
A group having a particular allegiance in a conflict or competition .
examples: there are two sides to every question
Although there are two sides to every story, the fallacy that they are inevitably equally ethical is called bothsidesism.
In the Second World War, the Italians were on the side of the Germans until Italy switched sides in 1943.

definitions.definition: A recorded piece of music ; a record , especially in jazz .
Sidespin ; english
examples: He had to put a bit of side on to hit the pink ball.

definitions.definition: A television channel , usually as opposed to the one currently being watched ( from when there were only two channels ) .
examples: I just want to see what's on the other side — James said there was a good film on tonight.

definitions.definition: A dish that accompanies the main course ; a side dish .
examples: Do you want a side of cole-slaw with that?

definitions.definition: A line of descent traced through a particular relative, usually a parent or spouse, as distinguished from that traced through another.
examples: his mother's side of the family

definitions.definition: The batters faced in an inning by a particular pitcher .
examples: Clayton Kershaw struck out the side in the 6th inning.

definitions.definition: An unjustified air of self-importance ; a conceited attitude.
A written monologue or part of a scene to be read by an actor at an audition .
A man who prefers not to engage in anal sex during same-sex sexual activity.
examples: My boyfriend and I are both sides ; we prefer to do oral and other stuff.

definitions.definition: A root .

main_definition: A bounding straight edge of a two-dimensional shape .
secondary_definitions: A flat surface of a three-dimensional object; a face .
One half (left or right, top or bottom, front or back, etc.) of something or someone.
A region in a specified position with respect to something.
The portion of the human torso usually covered by the arms when they are not raised ; the areas on the left and right between the belly or chest and the back .

One possible aspect of a concept , person , or thing .
One set of competitors in a game .
( UK , Australia , Ireland ) A sports team .
A group of morris dancers who perform together.
A group having a particular allegiance in a conflict or competition .

( sports , billiards , snooker , pool ) Sidespin ; english

A line of descent traced through a particular relative, usually a parent or spouse, as distinguished from that traced through another.

( slang , dated , uncountable ) An unjustified air of self-importance ; a conceited attitude.
( drama ) A written monologue or part of a scene to be read by an actor at an audition .
( LGBTQ , slang ) A man who prefers not to engage in anal sex during same-sex sexual activity.
( mathematics , obsolete ) A root .
